Scientists develop nano-enhanced textiles that can clean themselves when exposed to light

Now, clothes that can clean themselves

Australian scientists have found they are able to attach nano metal structures onto cotton which then catalyse a reaction that breaks down any grime on the fabric when exposed to light.

When exposed to light, it took less than six minutes for some of the nano-enhanced textiles to spontaneously clean themselves.
title: No more washing worries: coming soon, self-cleaning clothes
